ans.reasoning: The parse method is responsible for parsing the document structure. It calls parseStartTag and parseTextNode, which are critical for correctly interpreting the HTML content. If there is an issue in this method, it could lead to incorrect parsing of the document, which is likely the cause of the test failure.

The parseStartTag method handles the start tags and is crucial for building the document tree. If it fails to correctly identify or process a start tag, it could lead to malformed HTML structure, which may result in the observed test failure.

The parseTextNode method is responsible for creating text nodes from the parsed content. If it incorrectly processes text nodes, it could lead to missing or misplaced text in the final document, contributing to the test failure.

The addChildToParent method manages the relationship between parent and child elements in the document tree. While it is important, issues here are less likely to directly cause the specific test failure related to text content.
The outerHtml method simply appends data to a StringBuilder. It is less likely to be the source of the problem since it does not directly manipulate the document structure or parsing logic.
